msContents.summary: This illuminated Nepalese paper manuscript contains a collection of four dhāraṇis related to various goddesses, each represented in the illuminations at the beginning of the four texts (Vajravārāhīhṛdaya, Vajranairātmādevīhṛdayamantra, Sarvabuddhaḍākinīhṛdayamantra and Ugratārāhṛdaya).

msItem.title: Collection of Dhāraṇis
msItem.finalRubric: [4r5] || iti śrīvajravārāhihṛdaya nā[4v1]ma dhāraṇī samāpta[miniature]ḥ || mu || śubhaṃ ||
[10r1] || @ || iti śrīvajranairā¦[10r2]tmādevīhṛdayamantro dhārani samāpta || @ || [10r3] ye dharmmātyādi° || ku || śubhaṃ || ^^ ||
[16r1] || ^^^ || iti śrīsarvvabuddhaḍākinīhṛdayamantro dhāraṇī samāptaḥ || @ || ye dharmmātyādi°|| mu || śubhaṃ || @ ||
msItem.colophon: [22v3] yādiṣṭaṃ likhitaṃ mātā, tādṛṣṭaṃ likhitaṃ mayā [22v4] yadi śuddhaṃ vā m aśuddhaṁ vā mama dokho na vidyate || mu || śubhamaṃgalaṃ bhavantu sarvadā kāle śubhaṃ || mu || bhūyāt_ ||

supportDesc.condition: Complete, in good condition. Some folios look dirty or stained.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 22 akṣaras per line.
Quadruple marginal frame lines in red ink. Rubrics highlighted in red. Daṇḍas in red ink. Ruling.

decoNote.desc:
The beginnings of the various dhāraṇis are decorated with polichrome miniatures of approximately 5 cm in width, put in the centre of the page and covered with Japanese paper:
On f. 1v, representation of the goddess Vajravārāhī.
On f. 4v, representation of the goddess Vajranairātmādevī.
On f. 10v, representation of the goddess Sarvabuddhaḍākinī.
On f. 16v, representation the goddess Ugratārā.

item.marginalia: Running marginal titles (vajra, nairā, vidyā and ugra), top left margin, verso.

history.provenance:
Presented by Mrs. E.K. Waterhouse Waterhouse, E. K.
in 1957.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
